TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

The applicant ’s wife died on DATE . They had CARDINAL children from the marriage , born in DATE , DATE and DATE . In DATE the applicant applied for widows’ benefits and was informed that he was not entitled to these benefits as he was a man . He again claimed widows’ benefits in DATE . His claim was rejected on CARDINAL DATE on the ground that he was not entitled to widows’ benefits because he was not a woman . The applicant did not appeal as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no such social security benefits were payable to widowers under GPE law .
The applicant was not entitled to child benefit at the time of his claim .
The domestic law relevant to this application is set out in PERSON v. the GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-IV and Runkee and White v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
